reviews.sentence: Christmas in Germany. The hotel is not as impressive as other Renaissance resource. However the bar overlooking the mall area was clean and staff was friendly drinks were excellent. And the view was great. The breakfast dining area could definitely be improved. The chairs and tables could either be replaced or thoroughly cleaned they are very dated. the actual dining area is in need of remodeling the only good thing about it was the view. The first floor bar is quite impressive but closes early.

Would definitely stay again. Comfortable rooms Welcoming staff Breakfast buffet was delicious and thankfully we had a great 8th floor view of the harbor. We would definitely stay again. Room had some very minor repairs nededThe cabinet door hing broke and a ring cover for one of the sprinkle heads feel from the ceiling one morning. Lol. Made us laugh. Does not change our opinion would definitely stay again.

Nice place great staff needs an update. I was here for a conference and found the location is great. The hotel is comfortable and clean but tired. I stayed on the 10th floor and had a king bed room. Clean and relatively quiet. No view to speak of just a glass roof covering a pool I guess. The hallway carpets and wallpaper appear tired and in need of updating. One of the large windows on the corridor is shattered and needs replacement. The staff was outstanding. From the cable to my room and any questions they exceeded my expectations. If the common areas on upper floors were updated I would give a much higher rating.

Nice harbour hitel. Stayed one night for a boat ride at the harbor. Hotel is conveniently located off of I95 and the perfect location for hanging out in the Baltimore Harbor. Rooms are a decent size large flat screen television with decent channel selection. Nice sitting area with 2 chairs and an ottoman. Desk with chair and lamp. All the Lamps have sockets which is always very convenient. Bed was comfortable slept well. Connected to the Gallery mall which really did not have much of a shopping selection to offer although the fourth floor was closed for renovations. Across the street from Cheesecake Factory and Unos also Johnny Rockets and several other restaurants nearby in the area. Has a Starbucks in the lobby and the bar and cafe as well as an indoor pool. Hotel is a great choice if visiting the National Harbor. Would stay here again.

Bad experience. Came in from a long night of exploring the city and found that the sink was not draining. I was to tired to call the front desk to resolve this since it was 4 am in the morning. So the water just sat in the sink. I am assuming that the room next door was clogged too because I can hear maintenance using the plunger around 8 am. Maintenance came and knocked on my door at 830am to say that they needed to unclog my sink to fix the room next door. I was planning on sleeping until 1030 check out at 11. before I hit the road. So my girl friend and I had to rush to get our clothes on and pack our bags since several men were in and out of the room. did not even get a chance to brush my teeth. Called the front desk and they just blew me off saying we were not aware of what was going on and just said sorry have a nice day. Last time I stay there. Could of just slept in my car.

Great location but that ’s about all. Stayed at the renaissance for 2 nights over the Memorial Day weekend. Chose the hotel for its location overlooking the harbor and we had a great view from our room. Self parking was in the general garage for the shopping mall but valet was available. The hotel lobby was lively and modern with fresh lemonade and water available for free. Staff were friendly and helpful although we had to wait for an hour for new coffee supplies to be sent to the room after the daily service had omitted to replace them. Overall the room was comfortable but decor was dated and the hotel could do with a makeover. We were on the 9th floor and there was a convention going on so waiting for 1 of only 4 crowded elevators became annoying. The restaurant was great for breakfast and lunch did not have dinner there see separate review Would probably choose a different hotel if visiting the area again.

Great location and helpful staff. Lovely hotel in a superb location. Only suggestion would be to modernize the carpet and decor. I had stayed here a number of years ago when the decor was fresher. Staff here is great. Very attentive and helpful. Love how easy it I to self park here. Garage is directly below the lobby and easy to pull directly off I83 and get right into the garage. Also like that Mariots now offer the SPG 500 points per night to decline housekeeping. Great way to boost points. Their breakfast at the concierge lounge was great. Love all the fresh berries. The staff in the Lounge was great. Really knew the guests and made them comfortable.

Below expectations for a Renaissance. Traveling for business this is in a nice location. But the property is very tired and in need of a facelift not nearly as nice as other Renaissance hotels that I have stayed in. The staff is friendly. They are in need of a dedicated concierge though the gentleman I spoke with seemed to be the bellman. Asked for a restaurant recommendation that was local owned not chain the only one he gave me was Angies with brochure I was not impressed. Later I asked the valets outside again Angies and a stack of brochures. I believe that they are getting a kickback. We chose to go to Charlestons fabulous place a fine dining experience. Overall I would not recommend this hotel.

Beware of jackhamering. When we got to our room on Saturday the sound of jackhamering above us was deafening and gave my husband a headache. I called downstairs to see how long it would go on and was told that it was from noon to six. I asked for another room and we went downstairs to get one. Vivin came and helped us as we had to get in line again and ended up upgrading us because all of the other rooms we were offered had the noise problem. They are redoing the bathrooms in the place. If you will not be in your room between noon and six it ’s not a problem but otherwise discuss the issue with the staff and make sure you will get a room far away from the noise. I could understand putting us in a noisy room if it was after six as we were checking out the next day but it is a waste of time for everyone to put people in a noisy room like that. I blame the management for making that decision. The pool and spa were well kept and clean but the pool was very cold and I went into the hot tub to warm up after my swim. It was warmer the last time I was here. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable.

Greta Place. The hotel is located right next to the inner harbor and the Galleria Mall. They have a walkway to the Harbor. The You can easily walk to all the downtown attractions from here. The staff is very accommodating actually just downright friendly. Parking is available in the garage for about 30 a day. Many of the renovations are complete the new Club Lounge is very nice.

Great Experience. From the Front desk to the Concierge Lounge I received impeccable care and attention. The hotel has been recently redone and it is very upscale clean and comfortable. There is still a slight odor in the hallways from perhaps all the new restoration. The tv which was large misidentified me. Sadly the channels offered were fewer than I expected no HBO or Showtime. The Concierge Lounge recently redone no longer carries straws or plastic bottles water is available by filling glass carafes. The room itself was bright functional and upscale. The staff was very helpful especially with all the new machines. While the stay was near perfect the major and serious flaw was the hotel restaurant Watertable. The breakfast buffet served cold food in their chafing dishes they do not work or no one checks the temp. Dinner was overly expensive but very underwhelming probably the worst meal I ever had at a Mariot Renaissance property. Stay at the Renaissance and be pampered. This is the best location for the Inner Harbor. But skip the restaurant. Fogo de Chao is about two blocks east where you will spend the same money but will have a truly wonderful dining experience that you can and will remember and brag about.
Great location and very nice updated comfortable rooms.

Great Staff. Perfectly predictable Renaissance hotel with large newly renovated rooms and very comfortable beds. Staff were very welcoming and accommodating helped us secure a room with a bathtub which is unusual these days. Only complaints were regarding minor housekeeping issues a glass was left outside the room when we first arrived which was never retrieved and the room alarm went off before 6 am waking my 3 year old who never went back to sleep. Room service is more like take away with a 5 delivery charge but without the steep service charges you normally see for room service. With reasonable for a hotel prices. No minibar.

Wonderful in every way. I was at the Renaissance Baltimore in July for a conference. The hotel is really top notch in every way. The guest rooms and common areas alike were updated clean and very welcoming. Special mention to the Head Concierge Gary. What a kind friendly and knowledgeable man. He made me feel like we were old friends and was just so helpful and a pleasure to talk to. The location of this hotel is spectacular as well being right on the waterfront. I would recommend this hotel for business and pleasure travelers.
Reception was excellent. Very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice and newly renovated. Would definitely recommend.

All right. Good this hotel this hotel is very intresting me and I can say you thank you so much So good this because in this every product every customer very good job and one more thing I can rest on bed bed is so good and mind is very refresh mind cool so happy sleep thanks.
Enjoyed a fantastic experience learning about the renovations and culinary creations.

Great location. Right at the harbor front area. Very clean freshly updated decor. But be careful. This place is huge. There are only one set of elevators. My room was an insane walk for being inside a hotel. My room was on the corner of Lombard Calvert. The lobby is on Prat. There is an open courtyard in the center. So I had to walk the entire perimeter to get to my room in the back corner. Make sure to request a room near the elevators. Staff was great. The bartender Sheldon is great. The cream of crab in the Watertable restaurant is truly a Baltimore level crab delite. Jumbo lumps of crab. Overall a great stay.

Velocity tour. Great service. Greeted with smiles starting with the valet. Staff is so friendly. Gary and Derrick took care of myself and my daughter like we were family. Ca nt wait for next years convention. Restaurant Bar and ballroom renovations are fabulous.
